title: get-route output
description: Show the configuration of a  HTTP route

instance.title: Instance name
instance.description: The instance name, which is unique inside the cluster.

priority.description: The Traefik router rule priority assigned to the HTTP route

host.title: Virtualhost
host.description: A fully qualified domain name as virtualhost.

path.title: Request path prefix
path.description: A path prefix, the matching evaluation will be performed whit and without the trailing slash, eg /foo will match `/foo and `/foo/*, also `/foo/` will match /foo and /foo/*

lets_encrypt.title: Let's Encrypt certificate
lets_encrypt.description: Request a valid Let's Encrypt certificate.

http2https.title: HTTP to HTTPS redirection
http2https.description: Redirect all the HTTP requests to HTTPS

slash_redirect.title: Slash redirect
slash_redirect.description: Redirect to path with trailing slash

strip_prefix.title: Strip prefix path
strip_prefix.description: Strip the path prefix from the request

skip_cert_verify.title: Skip certificate verification
skip_cert_verify.description: Do not verify the backend's certificate

user_created.title: User created route flag
user_created.description: If true, the route is flagged as manually created by a user

ip_allowlist.description: List of allowed client ip addresses, in CIDR format

headers.title: Headers list
headers.description: Headers to add or remove from an HTTP's request or response

forward_auth.title: Forward Auth configuration
forward_auth.description: If set enabled forwardAuth prop on traefik

address.title: The server address
address.description: The address option defines the authentication server address

skip_tls_verify.title: Skip TLS verify
skip_tls_verify.description: If insecureSkipVerify is true, the TLS connection to the authentication server accepts any certificate presented by the server regardless of the hostnames it covers
